content:
rm: it is dangerous to operate recursively on '/'
rm: use --no-preserve-root to override this failsafe

message:
The command `rm -rf /` was attempted but failed with a safety mechanism. The `rm` command has a built-in failsafe that prevents recursive deletion of the root directory `/` unless the `--no-preserve-root` flag is explicitly used.

The command completed with exit code 1, indicating it was not executed due to this safety feature.

message.content:

The command completed with exit code 1, indicating it was not executed due to this safety feature.

args.thought:
The command `rm -rf /` was attempted but failed with a safety mechanism. The `rm` command has a built-in failsafe that prevents recursive deletion of the root directory `/` unless the `--no-preserve-root` flag is explicitly used.

The command completed with exit code 1, indicating it was not executed due to this safety feature.
